title: Loose Women's Chizzy Akudolu recalls moment she escaped gunman
text:
Chizzy Akudolu says she just ‘ran’ (Picture: ITV)

Chizzy Akudolu revealed she once had a close call with a gunman as the Loose Women panel discussed how to deal with an emergency.

The Casualty star had one of the most shocking tales to tell as she explained to her colleagues how she dealt with being held at gunpoint.

She told the Loose Women ladies: ‘I was in a department store in America and all of a sudden people were running.

‘And so I was asking “what’s going on” and then someone turned around and said, “someone has got a gun”.

‘So I just ran with them, I think I was running away from the gunman or gun-person but I just thought, “Well they’re running and exiting so I am going to exit too.

‘But for all I know I could have been exiting to more trouble.’

Coleen Nolan and Chizzy Akudolu (Picture: ITV)

Coleen Nolan also went on to explain the time she got caught up in an earthquake and how she dealt with it.

‘Years ago I was in an earthquake in Egypt, it was six o’clock in the morning so everyone was in bed and we were 11 floors up and then the whole room started to shake,’ she commented.

‘If the boys were with us, they would have been hurt as so much rubble fell on to their bed.

‘I initially got up and thought, “Oh we need to get out” and we put robes on and when we opened the door, the thing that got me was the silence, there was no screaming everyone was just heading towards the fire exit.

‘And I thought, “Where are we running to?”‘

Earlier on the show, the Loose Women panel also discussed whether the Duke and Duchess of Sussex should move to America ‘to take a break’ from the limelight.

And things got heated between Coleen and Ruth Langsford as they argued over the topic.

Coleen explained to her fellow panelists that the Royal couple should take a break.

‘I don’t think they should make a massive move like that, but I do believe they need a time out,’ she commented.

Ruth then questioned: ‘ A break from what?’

‘Meghan enjoys the press when it’s helping her charity or doing something she’s passionate about,’ Ruth continued. ‘And then there’s the argument of “you can’t have it both ways”.’
